1.name: Black Narcissus
1.description: After opening a convent in the Himalayas, five nuns encounter conflict and tension - both with the natives and also within their own group - as they attempt to adapt to their remote, exotic surroundings.

2.name: The Hucksters
2.description: A World War II veteran wants to return to advertising on his own terms, but finds it difficult to be successful and maintain his integrity.

3.name: Out of the Past
3.description: A private eye escapes his past to run a gas station in a small town, but his past catches up with him. Now he must return to the big city world of danger, corruption, double crosses and duplicitous dames.

4.name: Cass Timberlane
4.description: Judge Cass Timberlane marries a girl from the wrong side of the tracks, Virginia Marshland. A baby is stillborn and she turns more and more to attorney friend of of Cass', Bradd Criley. ...                See full summary »

5.name: Boomerang!
5.description: The true story of a prosecutor's fight to prove the innocence of a man accused of a notorious murder.

6.name: Miracle on 34th Street
6.description: When a nice old man who claims to be Santa Claus is institutionalized as insane, a young lawyer decides to defend him by arguing in court that he is the real thing.

7.name: The Woman on the Beach
7.description: A Coast Guardsman suffering from Post-Traumatic Stress becomes involved with a beautiful and enigmatic seductress married to a blind painter.

8.name: The Lady from Shanghai
8.description: Fascinated by gorgeous Mrs. Bannister, seaman Michael O'Hara joins a bizarre yachting cruise, and ends up mired in a complex murder plot.

9.name: The Ghost and Mrs. Muir
9.description: In 1900, a young widow finds her seaside cottage is haunted and forms a unique relationship with the ghost.

10.name: A Man About the House
10.description: Agnes and Ellen Isit, two poor English sisters, unexpectedly inherit from their uncle a rich estate near Naples, complete with big villa and manly Italian majordomo. The latter, Salvatore, ...                See full summary »

11.name: The Courtneys of Curzon Street
11.description: The fortunes of an upper-class British family are followed through three wars and four generations.

12.name: Good News
12.description: At fictitious Tait University in the Roaring 20's, co-ed and school librarian Connie Lane falls for football hero Tommy Marlowe. Unfortunately, he has his eye on gold-digging vamp Pat ...                See full summary »

13.name: Unconquered
13.description: Intrepid frontiersman Chris Holden foils the political and personal ambitions of renegade Martin Garth in the Ohio Valley following the French and Indian War.

14.name: Nightmare Alley
14.description: The rise and fall of Stanton Carlisle, a mentalist whose lies and deceit prove to be his downfall.

15.name: The Bishop's Wife
15.description: An angel in human form enters the life of a bishop in order to help him build a new cathedral and repair his fractured marriage.

16.name: Gentleman's Agreement
16.description: A reporter pretends to be Jewish in order to cover a story on anti-Semitism, and personally discovers the true depths of bigotry and hatred.

17.name: Dark Passage
17.description: A man convicted of murdering his wife escapes from prison and works with a woman to try and prove his innocence.

18.name: The Root of All Evil
18.description: A girl from an impoverished family is jilted by her rich fiance, whose father doesn't approve. She decides to take revenge against them, and determines to let nothing or no one stop her from getting to the top.

19.name: Jassy
19.description: In 17th. century England, Jassy is believed a witch because she has sometimes visions of approaching disasters. When Barney Hatton, an impoverished gentry whose gambling father has lost the...                See full summary »

20.name: Kiss of Death
20.description: Nick Bianco is caught during a botched jewellery heist. The prosecution offer him a more lenient sentence if he squeals on his accomplices but he doesn't roll over on them. Three years into the sentence an event changes his mind.

21.name: The Secret Life of Walter Mitty
21.description: A clumsy daydreamer gets caught up in a sinister conspiracy.

22.name: Framed
22.description: Mike Lambert, seeking a mining job, instead becomes the patsy for a femme-fatale's schemes.

23.name: The Paradine Case
23.description: A happily married London barrister falls in love with the accused poisoner he is defending.

24.name: Ramrod
24.description: Violent feud between Connie Dickason, the owner of the Circle 66 ranch and rancher Frank Ivey, the self-proclaimed boss of an otherwise public grazing land.

25.name: Monsieur Verdoux
25.description: A suave but cynical man supports his family by marrying and murdering rich women for their money, but the job has some occupational hazards.

26.name: The Red House
26.description: An old man and his sister are concealing a terrible secret from their adopted teen daughter, concerning a hidden abandoned farmhouse, located deep in the woods.

27.name: Dead Reckoning
27.description: A soldier runs away rather than receive the Medal of Honor, so his buddy gets permission to investigate, and love and death soon follow.

28.name: Brute Force
28.description: At a tough penitentiary, prisoner Joe Collins plans to rebel against Captain Munsey, the power-mad chief guard.

29.name: Angel and the Badman
29.description: Quirt Evans, an all round bad guy, is nursed back to health and sought after by Penelope Worth, a Quaker girl. He eventually finds himself having to choose between his world and the world Penelope lives in.

30.name: The Sea of Grass
30.description: On America's frontier, a St. Louis woman marries a New Mexico cattleman who is seen as a tyrant by the locals.

31.name: Fun & Fancy Free
31.description: Jiminy Cricket hosts two Disney animated shorts: "Bongo," about a circus bear escaping to the wild, and "Mickey and the Beanstalk," a take on the famous fairy tale.

32.name: Odd Man Out
32.description: A wounded Irish nationalist leader attempts to evade police following a failed robbery in Belfast.

33.name: The Bachelor and the Bobby-Soxer
33.description: A high school girl falls for a playboy artist, with screwball results.

34.name: Life with Father
34.description: A financier from New York rules his numerous family, consisting of his wife and his four sons, with the meticulousness of a bookkeeper.

35.name: I Walk Alone
35.description: Frankie Madison leaves prison expecting a share from his ex-partner. But Prohibition bootlegging didn't prepare Frankie for Big Business.

36.name: Secret Beyond the Door...
36.description: When a lovely woman and her new husband settle in an ancient mansion on the East coast, she discovers that he may want to kill her.

37.name: Crossfire
37.description: A man is murdered, apparently by one of a group of demobilized soldiers he met in a bar. But which one? And why?

38.name: My Favorite Brunette
38.description: Shortly before his execution on the death row in San Quentin, amateur sleuth and baby photographer Ronnie Jackson, tells reporters how he got there.

39.name: Lured
39.description: A serial killer in London is murdering young women he meets through the personal columns of newspapers. He announces each of his murders to the police by sending them a cryptic poem. After ...                See full summary »

40.name: Forever Amber
40.description: In seventeenth-century England, Amber St. Clair aims to raise herself from country girl to nobility, and succeeds, but loses her true love in the process.

41.name: Born to Kill
41.description: A calculating divorcée risks her chances at wealth and security with a man she doesn't love by getting involved with the hotheaded murderer romancing her foster sister.

42.name: A Double Life
42.description: Anthony John is an actor whose life is strongly influenced by the characters he plays. When he's playing comedy, he's the most enjoyable person in the world, but when he's playing drama, ...                See full summary »

43.name: They Made Me a Fugitive
43.description: After WW2, former RAF airman Clem Morgan joins a gang of black-market smugglers-thieves but when a robbery goes wrong, Clem is caught , framed for a policeman's murder, and is sent to prison where he plots his escape and revenge.

44.name: Daisy Kenyon
44.description: Daisy Kenyon (Joan Crawford) is a commercial artist living in New York City and having a 'back street' affair with a married lawyer, Dan O'Mara (Dana Andrews), whom she hopes to marry as ...                See full summary »

45.name: Ride the Pink Horse
45.description: WW2 veteran Lucky Gagin arrives in a New Mexico border-town intent on revenging against mobster Frank Hugo but FBI agent Bill Retz, who also wants Hugo, tries to keep Gagin out of trouble.

46.name: The Egg and I
46.description: On their wedding night, Bob reveals to Betty that he has purchased an abandoned chicken farm. Betty struggles to adapt to their new rural lifestyle, especially when a glamorous neighbor seems to set her eyes on Bob.

47.name: Song of the Thin Man
47.description: Nick and Nora investigate the murder of a bandleader in New York.

48.name: T-Men
48.description: Two US Treasury agents hunt a successful counterfeiting ring.

49.name: Skepp till India land
49.description: A sailor returns to his hometown after 7 years and remembered the dark and the light moments of his past.

50.name: Tycoon
50.description: In South America, an American engineer is asked by his boss to build a mountain railroad tunnel following a shorter but more dangerous route.
